title: Strictly Come Dancing: Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe eliminated
text:
Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe have become the latest shock elimination from Strictly Come Dancing.

The pair landed in the bottom and became the fifth couple to exit the dancefloor after a split decision between the judges in an intense discussion.

Up against firm favourites to leave the competition, Mike Bushell and Katya Jones, the pair were given the axe after failing to impress with their Cha Cha to Scared Of The Dark by Steps during Halloween week.

Mike and Katya performed a Tango to What You Waiting For by Gwen Stefani.

Catherine was left in tears at the final decision, praising new ‘best friend’ Johannes for helping her find her love of dance.

She told Tess: ‘Just the opportunity to work with amazing people and get critiqued off amazing people.

‘I never thought I’d say this, I’m going to keep it up because I fell in love with it! I’ve loved every second, this man has changed my life!’

Catherine and Johannes were devastated to leave (Picture: BBC)

Johannes was just as emotional as his Corrie star partner and said: ‘Most of all, I want to say thank you to this woman. She has been a light for me.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Thank you for accepting me for who I am and for showing me joy every day. Thank you!’

Their position in the dance-off comes despite Chris Ramsey and Karen Hauer falling to the bottom of the leaderboard with only 23 points.

The couple faced Mike and Katya in the dance off (Picture: BBC)

Catherine and Johannes scored 24 points, placing them second lowest, while Mike and Katya were third lowest.

In the first split decision of the series, Motsi Mabuse opted to save Catherine and Johannes saying they had ‘a strong performance, stronger body actions and stronger leg actions.’

Bruno Tonioli agreed and said: ‘It’s hard because you’ve both done very, very well, but purely based on tonight I have to save the couple that got me tingling a little bit more and I have to save Catherine & Johannes.’

Catherine was consoled by the other celebrities as they said their goodbyes (Picture: BBC)

But Craig Revel Horwood said Mike and Katya deserved to stay as they ‘stepped it up a notch’ in the dance-off – sending it to head judge Shirley Ballas for the deciding vote.

Controversially, despite their low scores throughout the show’s run, Mike and Katya were chosen by her to stay.

More: Strictly Come Dancing Catherine Tyldesley shares bittersweet photo as she details Strictly journey Strictly Come Dancing backlash as Catherine Tyldesley is eliminated from series Strictly Come Dancing's Neil Jones 'could miss next week' as Alex Scott gives update

‘I thought both couples really step it up a notch and this is always the most difficult decision for me,’ she said.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘But based on a good focus, difficult content, with some really beautiful footwork in there with stronger technical skills for me, cleaner and polished. I’m going to save Mike & Katya.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm with the results show on Sunday at 7.15pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe faced the dance-off but Mike Bushell and Katya Jones got Shirley Ballas' deciding vote.
